ETYMOLOGY: From Latin commentārius 'notebook, annotation', from commentārī 'to comment upon, discuss', from com- (intensive prefix) + mentārī 'to think, devise'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A detailed explanation or interpretation of a text, event, or situation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对文本、事件或情况的详细解释或阐述。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The book provides an insightful commentary on modern society.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这本书对现代社会提供了深刻的评论。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A broadcast description of an event as it happens, often delivered by a speaker.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对正在发生的事件（尤指体育赛事）的广播解说或口头描述。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We listened to the live commentary of the football match on the radio.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们在收音机上听了足球比赛的现场解说。

REGISTER: Common in academic, journalistic, and broadcast contexts.
